contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{CBA team | color1 = #F0DC99 | color2 = #082567 | logo = Rockford_lightning_logo.jpg | pixels = 150px | founded = 1978 | league = [[International Basketball League (1999-2001)|IBL]] 2000-2001 <br> [[Continental Basketball Association|CBA]] 1978-2000 2001-2006 2007-2009 | history = Lancaster Red Roses<br>1978-1980 <br> Philadelphia Kings<br>1980-1981 <br> Lancaster Lightning<br>1981-1985 <br> Baltimore Lightning<br>1985-1986 <br> Rockford Lightning<br>1986-2006 | arena = [[Rockford MetroCentre]] | city = Rockford, Illinois | colors = Navy Blue, Gold, Light Blue | owner = | coach = Chris Daleo | championships = | titles = 5 (2003, 2002, 2000, 1996, 1993) | cheerleaders = Rockford Lightning Girls | dancers = Lightning Boltz | mascot = Freddy Flash | h_body = 00008B | h_pattern_b = _thinsidesonwhite | h_shorts = 00008B | h_pattern_s = _blanksides2 | a_body = 00008B | a_pattern_b = _vegasgoldsides | a_shorts = 00008B | a_pattern_s = _Gold Stripes adidas }} The '''Rockford Lightning''' was a [[basketball]] team that played in the [[Continental Basketball Association]]. They were based in [[Rockford, Illinois]]. The Lightning were the oldest team in the CBA, originally existing as the '''[[Lancaster Red Roses (basketball)|Lancaster Red Roses]]''' from [[Lancaster, Pennsylvania]]. That team changed their name to the '''Lancaster Lightning''', then the franchise moved to [[Baltimore, Maryland|Baltimore]] for a year before relocating in Rockford. Their home arena was the [[Rockford MetroCentre|MetroCentre]]. They were the runners-up in the 2001-02 and 2004-05 CBA seasons, losing a winner-take-all championship game to the [[Dakota Wizards]] 116-109 in 2002, and a best-of-5 series to the [[Sioux Falls Skyforce]] 3-1 in 2005. On January 20, 2006, the team's owner announced that the Lightning would cease operations after the season unless other investors purchased the team and continued its operations. An attempt was made to constitute a new local ownership group, but it was unsuccessful, and the team folded.
